intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium calodon subsp. rhenovulcanicum, commonly known as the Rhenovulcanian hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and sandy soils. It features a basal rosette of leaves and produces yellow flowers in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
